data.title: Best Italian dining in Cape Coral!
data.text:
We have been customers since Little Sicily started on Pine Island Road years ago. They are closed right now in the midst of a complete renovation and major expansion.  Cannot wait for them to reopen this fall. 

Family operation with amazing recipes, a wonderful atmosphere and easy parking in the front and back. Our "go-to" choice just a few blocks west of the bridge coming in from Ft. Myers on Cape Coral Parkway.

data.title: Delightful
data.text: Food is wonderful. Family run place that is cozy, but very friendly. Prices are moderate, and the owner is there to prepare your dishes.

data.title: Authentic Italian
data.text: Amazing Rice Balls and Sicilian Pizza. Friendly service, everything was fresh and Authentic Italian. Can't wait to come back and try some of your dinners and desserts.

data.title: EXCELLENT authentic Italian food.
data.text: This is a tiny place but you will be treated like family.  Very inexpensive for the high quality of food that is provided.  You will leave feeling that you visited an Italian Families Home

data.title: Fantastic service
data.text: We came in near closing time with a group on our family vacation and although the restaurant only had a few more days of business before remodeling they were welcoming, friendly and helpful. The food was also very delicious. We would certainly return.

data.title: Absolutely the best food in town!
data.text: WOW!! This was an amazing find for a vacation dinner. This place is family owned, and they make everything homemade. The service is fantastic, and the food is even better. The lasagna and manicotti were the best I've tasted. Another member of the group said the same for the spaghetti. The pizza is great with a crisp crust that is not greasy. Finally the Spumoni pie is great and best was the cannoli which is handmade in the kitchen by miss Mima. We will be going back before going home!

data.title: Another great meal
data.text: Popped in on the off chance they may have a table, they were so welcoming and the food was excellent, severed in good time no rush to get you out friendly and passionate about their food and service. We stop there every time we are over from the UK, look forward to visiting again later in the year once their remodeling has been done expanding into the store next door I believe!!

data.title: Good pizza!
data.text: The pizza we had was pretty good.  It's always kind of hard when your out of town to know where to go.

data.title: Amazing FRESH Italian
data.text: So very happy we found this place. Great friendly family service and made fresh to order dinners! I made a special request for Eggplant Marsala and the chef came to our table to discuss what we were looking for and it was amazing.  Good wine selection and reasonable prices.  Friendly staff, plenty of parking in the rear. They will be closed in July to expand. When they reopen, be sure to stop in. Best in the Cape.

data.title: Amazing Italian food
data.text: Just like being back in Italy! The Arancini/Rice Balls are to die for. Love Mama's cooking very authentic.

data.title: Excellent food
data.text: We have been there with friends after we heard a lot of this little gem. And it is a little gem. Very friendly staff, great kitchen and the food tasted great. Pizza looked and tasted very good with a crunchy crust, Gnocchi and Baked Clams delicious.

data.title: Magnificent Food and Most Wonderful Owners and Staff
data.text:
My husband and I read the reviews of this local restaurant on TripAdvisor and our experience here went above and beyond our expectations. 

It was our first visit to the beautiful city of Cape Coral, which we fell in love with, and we always check out Italian restaurants in a new area. It is so excellent here at Sicily Trattoria that we went twice. The owner Vincenzo was there both times to greet us and made us feel at home.  It truly is family run as the first time his Aunt was cooking and the second time his Mom.  

Inside it is warm and inviting but the food is beyond explanation. The first time I had their Penne alla Vodka and my husband their Linguini Bolognese. The pasta truly is homemade and melts in your mouth. And those sauces are to die for.  It came with the most delicious Minestrone Soup and homemade bread.

The second time we had Veal Marsala and Ravioli with Bolognese Sauce (the sauce was soooo good the first time, we had to have it again!). The raviolis once again melted in your mouth. And that veal was the best we've ever had. They get their meats specially made and you can tell. This day their soup was Manhattan Clam Chowder that was super. 

I don't have the words to say how great the meals were, but we truly felt we were in Italy. And their prices are so reasonable. The second time in we met Vincenzo's cousin, Manny, and he also made us feel at home. The food speaks for itself, but we fell in love with the family. We will miss them and can't wait to return.

data.title: Not the best NY style pizza!
data.text: This was the first time my husband and I visited along with another couple. It is a really small place and the first thing I noticed when I walked in the door was the heat coming from the pizza oven. It is already hot enough in FL and I want we to eat in A/C if we are inside. It was crowded as well, being so small, which didn't help. We ordered the stuffed mushrooms as an appetizer, they were just OK. Then we ordered two NY style pizzas and waited at least 30 plus minutes or more before they arrived. When they did, the table was so small they didn't fit on the table. They don't have the elevated pizza trays like they do in most pizza places. The waitress brought over a side table and we put a pizza there. Again, it was just OK. The crust was crispy so you can't fold it like traditional NY pizza. Since there are many pizza places in the Cape we will continue to find the best NY style pizza. Needless to say, we won't be back. Stay tuned....

data.title: little Mom/Pop/Grandma/daughters place with southern Italian food
data.text: Best red sauce on the Cape.  Their bolognese is the best.  Stick with Sicilian favorites, lasagna, manicotti, meatballs, arancini and when she makes it, Nonna's tagliatelle.  Meat dishes are average, but he Sicilian pizza is great too.

data.title: good pizza
data.text: Pizza was great, just a little expensive. Definately will return for more! Thank you ! Keep up the good work!

data.title: Amazing Food and treat you like Family
data.text: We went with our 3 daughters. The pizzas are Fresh, cooked to perfection. The employees talk to you like you are family. We will now be regulars!!

data.title: WOW!
data.text: Out of town friends picked this spot (based on reviews they had  read) to meet for dinner.  It looked unassuming and we didn't expect much.  We were so very pleasantly surprised.  First, we were warmly greeted and shown a table.  Our waitress, Jamie, immediately asked if it was our first time there as she didn't recognize any of us.  She assured us we were in for a treat.  We split an arancini (crisp light crust, creamy cheesy center with just the right amount of bolognese) and calamari frite (very nicely prepared). Two of us had house salads (ordinary but the dressing was good) and two lentil soup (rich and delicious).  The manicotti was excellent, penne alla vodka had just the right amount of sauce, and the veal Marsala was tender and delicious.  But the star of our meal was the homemade tagliatelle.  That night it had been made with sundried tomatoes.  One could have it with your choice of sauce. I asked what the chef recommended - the answer, Alfredo.  It was the best pasta dish I've ever had outside of Italy.  The pasta was incredible and cooked to perfection and the Alfredo sauce was creamy and light.  We finished with a cannoli - crisp shell with a sweet creamy filling.  It's family owned and operated - met several of them and they couldn't have been nicer or more appreciative of our enjoyment of their restaurant.  Only criticism was the wine was warm.  Would have been better if it had been served about 60 degrees F.  BTW, the pizza looked wonderful and many people had it - definitely will go back to try it!

data.title: Great Food
data.text: Used to be located on Pine Island Road in the North Cape.  Food very authentic and reasonably priced.

data.title: the best authentic Italian food I ever had!!!
data.text: Been there numerous times and I have to say its the best authentic Italian food hands down.Growing up in a Sicilian family I know what is good and the food speaks for its self.!!!

data.title: Great Pizza!!!!
data.text: It was late on Thursday last week and we wanted Pizza and my Mother mentioned a chain restaurant that I don't care for. I said lets check Trip Advisor and see where the pizza is in your town. Thats how we found Little Sicily Trattoria. Pizza was flavorful, crisp traditional thin crust that you can fold without!!!! breaking.. A true pizza.. Cooked to perfection!! We had a veggie and a sausage and veggie. Both excellent!!! We will be back. Because I want Arancini!!!! And rigatoni bolognese!! Can't wait to have pizza again too.. Cute small place that has wine and beer if you like. Nice small menu.. With a lot of care taken. Thank you!
